definition: abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])
to be underwhelmed/to be less than impressed

sentences.english: He felt carried away as long as hearing some flattering words.
sentences.chinese: 他只要聽到幾句恭維話就會得意忘形。

sentences.english: School teachers probably cringe at this kind of pronunciation.
sentences.chinese: 學校的老師們對這樣的發音恐怕是不敢恭維。

sentences.english: Mr. Lee often says complimentary words to his boss.
sentences.chinese: 李先生常對他老闆說恭維的話。

sentences.english: It left examples of his complimenting Republicans on the cutting-room floor.
sentences.chinese: 它留下了他的恭維切割室地板共和黨人例子。

sentences.english: To her aesthetic vision, we can boast about.
sentences.chinese: 對於她的審美眼光，我們可不敢恭維。

sentences.english: There was all the usual humbug and obligatory compliments from ministers.
sentences.chinese: 全都是些部長們常說的騙人鬼話和少不了的奉承恭維。

sentences.english: Another hazard that topples schedules is flattery.
sentences.chinese: 使得時間表混亂的另一個可能事件是恭維。

sentences.english: Everybody loves to hear a compliment now and then; that is, if it's genuine.
sentences.chinese: 每個人或多或少都愛聽真誠的恭維。

sentences.english: So flatter I the swart- complexioned night.
sentences.chinese: 也恭維黑夜，說如果星星暗淡。

sentences.english: A word of admiration holds more value for her than compliments.
sentences.chinese: 於她而言，一句真誠讚美比恭維話要受用的多。

sentences.english: Chili hose jian-ye liu to bubble hot spring, jian-ye liu compliment on the way.
sentences.chinese: 辣椒水帶着劉建業來泡溫泉，劉建業一路恭維。

sentences.english: Thee minister is averse to flattery.
Joe Cole has some compliments on Liverpool.
sentences.chinese: 喬科爾又對利物浦一番恭維。
那倒是一則譏諷的恭維話。

sentences.english: An elderly patient paid me a wonderful compliment.
sentences.chinese: 一個老病友給了我一個奇妙的恭維。

definition: to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
impossible/can't be done/no can do/unable to accomplish
to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
roll call/to mention sb by name/(to call or praise or criticize sb) by name
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
